revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=AMIT |model=WIP-301 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=12/14/2000 |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=Yes |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=PBLWIP-301 |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=3 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=AMD |cpu1_model=Am186 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=Parallel |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial=DE-9 |wi1_module=Gemtek WLANAP00 |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=No Wires Needed |wi1_chip1_model=Poldhu |wi1_chip2_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip2_model=HFA3861 |wi1_chip3_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip3_model=HFA3683A |wi1_802dot11_protocols=b |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand=Realtek |eth_chip1_model=RTL8019AS |eth_chip2_brand=Realtek |eth_chip2_model=RTL8019AS |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Kendin |sw_model=KS8995 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips= |flags=schematics, block diagram |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=b |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.123.254 |default_user= |default_pass=admin |oui= |oui_eth= |default_ch= }} "34-WIP301-3B VER B" (or something like that) is silkscreened on the mainboard in the FCC photos.
LAN and WAN interfaces for the router are both 10Mbit. The switch is, however, 10/100 Mbit capable.
This device is assumed to use '''NWN''''s Poldhu chip.
Default settings (including the SSID) are per the FCC manual.
The power supply shown in the FCC photos is a '''SILICORE''' SWF-5 Rev 1.0a (90-264VAC ~ 50/60Hz -> 5VDC, 3A).
